definitions.definition: To resolve (a contest , problem , dispute , etc.); to choose , determine , or settle .
examples: The election will be decided on foreign policies.
It was decide d to meet here at midnight.
Her last-minute goal decided the game.

definitions.definition: To make a judgment , especially after deliberation .
examples: You must decide between good and evil.
I have decided that it is healthier to walk to work.

definitions.definition: To cause someone to come to a decision .
examples: Your admonition decide d me against my intended course of action .

definitions.definition: Of a Turing machine : to return a correct answer (for some yes-or-no problem) on every possible input .
examples: No Turing Machine can decide the halting problem .

main_definition: ( ambitransitive ) To resolve (a contest , problem , dispute , etc.); to choose , determine , or settle .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive ) To make a judgment , especially after deliberation .
( transitive ) To cause someone to come to a decision .
( computing theory ) Of a Turing machine : to return a correct answer (for some yes-or-no problem) on every possible input .
( obsolete ) To cut off; to separate.
